Theragun + Red Light Therapy

A gentle, effective way to relax soft tissue and support recovery.

What Is Theragun + Red Light Therapy?

In my Midtown Manhattan studio near Penn Station, I use Theragun percussive therapy combined with red light therapy as a supportive technique to help reduce muscle tension, improve circulation, and prepare the body for deeper, more targeted treatment like shockwave, Class 4 laser, or TECAR therapy.

This combination is not meant to replace corrective exercise or advanced therapyâ€”it simply helps soften tight areas, reduce nervous-system sensitivity, and make it easier for your body to move with less resistance during the rest of your session.

How It Works

Theragun Percussive Therapy

  • Gentle rhythmic percussion to reduce muscle tension
  • Helps improve circulation and tissue pliability
  • Useful for sensitive or tight areas that donâ€™t tolerate deep pressure
  • Great as a warm-up before corrective exercise or neuromuscular work

Red Light Therapy

  • Low-level light supports cellular energy production
  • Helps calm minor inflammation and tissue irritation
  • Non-invasive and gentle on sensitive areas
  • Pairs well with soft-tissue work to support recovery

Benefits of This Combination

  • Helps reduce muscle tightness in a gentle, non-aggressive way
  • Improves circulation and prepares tissue for deeper techniques
  • Supports recovery after exercise or long periods of sitting
  • Useful for general tension in the neck, shoulders, hips, or back
  • Provides a relaxing start before corrective movement training

What Does a Session Feel Like?

Youâ€™ll feel rhythmic, comfortable percussion along with gentle warmth from the red light. Itâ€™s relaxing and non-invasive, making it a great option for people who prefer milder soft-tissue work or who have sensitive areas that donâ€™t tolerate intense pressure.

Iâ€™ll help you decide when Theragun + Red Light is appropriate and how it fits into your overall treatment plan. Itâ€™s often a useful starting point before deeper work or corrective exercise.
